awd_titl_txt: RUI: Development and Characterization of Organic Thin Films
awd_abstract_narration: This research program will focus on the development and                         characterization of organic thin films deposited by thermal                     evaporation under vacuum.  The project entails optimization of                  the thin film deposition process, structural studies of the                     organic films and systematic characterization of organic film-                  based structures.  Measurements include current-voltage                         characteristics to understand physical processes of conduction                  and breakdown, capacitance-voltage characteristics to determine                 nature and density of surface states.  The overall objective is                 to make a realistic assessment of potential applications of the                 thermally grown films in active electronic devices such as MIS                  structures.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
